title: Why do people act like J4 ult is useless?
body: Not every champion has mobility, even if they have mobility then you can wait to use it.  It still does tons of damage, even if all it does is deal damage and burn a flash it is still worth. A flash is a lot of kill pressure in a lane.

Sol and Ryze can escape this, if I'm not wrong.
It's funny that there are like 5-6 popular champions in your list. The rest are rarely seen.

Sol can fly, but the moment he gets hit the flight gets cancelled. So as long as you keep attacking him, he has no way to escape.

Ryze's Ult is able to escape, that is true. But it has a long delay, you got enough time to burst him down.

If he _could_ activate his flight, the microsecond of flight between Jarvan autoattacks would allow him to escape the ult, honestly.  But he can't activate his flight until he's been out of combat for 5 seconds.

Guess her ult is useless for its intended purpose.

Saying an ult has high damage when that's not what it's supposed to be for it a dumb argument. J4's ult is supposed to break up teams and/or single out target, it's not supposed to be an assassination ability for nuking someone down.

Camille's ult is a terrible example, getting her out of it is supposed to be the counterplay to it and it's purpose is to prevent someone from leaving an area and singling out a target, no amount of mobility will get you out of her ult, you need to force her to leave it or fight her.
The issue is that its most useful against the champs that are the least mobile when its the kind of thing you want to be good at keeping the slippery, mobile champs pinned down.
